value: File:View of Macclesfield from Macclesfield train station.jpg
Macclesfield from the town's train station.

Macclesfield is on the main train line between
and is easily accessed from both by high speed trains (Manchester 20 minutes, London 1 hour 45 minutes). Some Cross Country services between Manchester and
also call at Macclesfield. Local stopping services are available to Manchester and

. The train station is located in the town centre, just to the east of the main shopping area.

By road, the nearest motorway is the M6. From the north, take Junction 19, and travel through
. From the south, use Junction 17 and follow the signs for
until Macclesfield is signposted. In either direction, the distance from the motorway is about 15 miles. From the east, the main road into the town is the A537 from
road after the pub at its summit. It is a scenic route, but in winter it is occasionally impassable.
is 12 miles away. By taxi the fare is typically about £25 if pre-booked.

The town centre is easily traversable by foot. Buses to suburbs and nearby towns depart from the bus station on Queen Victoria Street. From the train station go up the hill and follow the road to the left.

value: , stairs running from east of St. Michael's down to Waters Green.

content=A warm and welcoming pub with drinks at decent prices (cheaper than the other pubs in Macclesfield but have a much wider range of drinks). Live bands play nearly every weekend and the music ranges from Indie to Metal to Tribute bands.

Decadent 18th Century country house, 6 miles north-west of the town.
